name: climdex.pcic.ncdf
tagline: R package to compute Climdex indices on gridded NetCDF files
body:
# What is climdex.pcic.ncdf?

* `climdex.pcic.ncdf` is a companion library for `climdex.pcic` which helps in using NetCDF input grids and writing to NetCDF output files when computing the [27 core indices of extreme climate](http://etccdi.pacificclimate.org/list_27_indices.shtml). The code allows for parallel computation of indices using either a SOCK or MPI cluster. It was written for the [R statistical programming language](http://www.r-project.org/) by the [Pacific Climate Impacts Consortium](http://pacificclimate.org/).

# Getting Help

## New to programming or to R?

* Read the the [Software Carpentry](http://software-carpentry.org/index.html)  [Programming in R](http://software-carpentry.org/v5/novice/r/index.html) lessons
* Read one of the man [R Manuals](http://cran.r-project.org/manuals.html).
* Attend an [R Users Group](http://r-users-group.meetup.com/) meeting.

## Looking for code?

* Get the latest [climdex.pcic.ncdf release from our website](http://www.pacificclimate.org/~bronaugh/climdex.pcic.ncdf_0.5-4.tar.gz).
* Explore the [development repository](https://github.com/pacificclimate/climdex.pcic.ncdf/).

## Need help using the package?

* Read the manual
```R
    > library(climdex.pcic.ncdf)
    Loading required package: PCICt
    > ?climdex.pcic.ncdf
```
* Create a [new issue](https://github.com/pacificclimate/climdex.pcic.ncdf/issues/new) on the [package issue tracker](https://github.com/pacificclimate/climdex.pcic.ncdf/issues) and label it "help wanted"[1].

## Want to contribute?

* To report a bug in pcic.climdex use the [package issue tracker](https://github.com/pacificclimate/climdex.pcic.ncdf/issues) (after you've read the [bug reporting guide](https://github.com/pacificclimate/climdex.pcic.ncdf/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst#bug-reports)).
* To help with development read through the [contributor's guide](https://github.com/pacificclimate/climdex.pcic.ncdf/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).

## Still need help?

* Contact climate@uvic.ca and let us know what we can do.

[1] Please know that the pool of people who can provide support for the package is extremely small and time is limited.  We don't necessarily have the capacity for long, open-ended user support. If you keep your questions short, specific and direct, there's a greater probability that someone will take on the ticket.
